So I just tested this again and it works for me on the x86 and my MAC.  With alpha9 OMPI.  In one of the comments, Anirban, you copy some error messages.  Are you still getting those errors?  If it actually gives Java errors then something is really wrong.

Thanks, sorry for all the back and forth - hard when we're not seeing the same bug. :(

Just a check: Try creating a completely new PTP install (eclipse 3.1.x, CDT 3.0.2, PTP 1.0.0, and set up project more or less like 
http://www.eclipse.org/ptp/documentation/org.eclipse.ptp.help/html/01buildMPIprog.html#mpicc
You have the mpi toolchain commands on the CDT build page too  right?

I think i saw those same stack traces at one time a while back too,
and no output as you said, but they went away at some point in the testing
by redoing everything.  
Try doing a cleanupOmpi.sh before launching, too (but I think maybe Nathan has a workaround for this problem... altho it can't hurt)
see the FAQ#8 for the details, which points to
http://www.eclipse.org/ptp/docs/build.html#cleanupOmpi

This was fixed a while back, forgot to delete the bug :(.  It wasn't an output problem but one where the user's PTP proxy was crashing and we didn't have any messages relaying that to him - so he thought his job was running and not displaying output.  It may have even have been running - orte having spawned it, but the proxy was definitely dead.  Lots of bug searching and we found the problem, fixed it for his architecture.  Also we're working on better error messages / dialogs which would have made this easier to locate.
